WRITING.TEXT: I find 2 imodium for an entire 24 hours will stop loose stool.rarely do I need 3 unless it's liquid D.

I'd want to work as concierge in one of the hotels. Maybe in a moderate or deluxe. I love planning so getting people's tickets purchased, restaurant reservations done, and giving them guidance on what to do sounds fun to me.

I get this often. I have ibs d so I take immodium often but at times it feels like things have stopped right by the end of my sphincter, so even though I can't go I feel the pressure like I have to for hours.
You mean viberzi? Personally it did nothing for me. Took it 4 weeks with no help. But every body is different. I've heard people on here say great things.
I found this more endearing than cringey.
yeah. same. the rumbling either means im about to have D, or alternatively i havent eaten enough.
At my current work place, we have 3 stalls for about... i dont know...40+ women? And i rarely, if ever, have had to wait. So i think your odds are better!
Been there! I sat through two fillings with serious rumblings. But i figured if the D hit, id just have to be honest and say i needed a "break" and go to the bathroom. Luckily that never happened.
This. I did this for a trip to Morocco some years ago. I'm going to Portugal for a week and I will do it again (Especially since i am traveling with my boyfriend's family).

I'm a social media engagement manager. I am in an office most of my day, once in a while meeting with clients in their offices or at events we may be running to cover for social media platforms, but rarely. I do often have days FULL of meetings, which can be stressful when not feeling well, but i work at a laid back digital agency and with a boss who knows my IBS issues and is accommodating. I still try to do the best I can, despite often being late, or sometimes leaving early if I'm having really bad D or nausea. Somehow it hasn't affected performance as I've gotten a promotion as well as two raises in the 2 years ive been there, but i do have a serious fear it one day will get called out.
I just started getting this as well. One time I was so nauseous, i went to bed with it, woke up with it, and dry heaved a bit. Then i had watery D and felt better. It was a grand ol' time.
Oh apologies, i interpreted as the two universal parks. other wise yes, a cab or rental car are your options.

There is, via hogwarts express. Im getting a 1 day park hopper and doing just Harry Potter. Ive seen pretty much everything else it has to offer, so my focus is just HP. But, hogwarts express will get you from park to park regardless if that's your focus or not.

7 days is a good sweet spot, to me. 5 days parks, 2 travel days where you can just relax and do other things (disney springs, boardwalk, etc). I have an 8 day trip upcoming because 1 day universal. I think more than that, personally, is starting to hit too much.

WRITING.TITLE: Does anyone overstress about eating bad food?
WRITING.TEXT: as in, food that's gone bad? I get really crazy about how long anything sits out, like more than i ever used to. I just assume ill react worse than a normal person. I just ate a tuna sandwich that had a bad slice of tomato on it...it tasted off but i didnt realize til i finished that half. And now im freaking out im going to be sick, even though it was just a thin slice. I can't stop thinking about it. Does anyone else just feel super aware of things like that?
ah ok! Sorry didn't understand you meant earlier. :)

Not true; the system allows 5 minutes ahead of time always. As long as your light turns green, they will let you in. Never had the issue at any attraction, busy or not :) Source: I have 3 cast member friends who i see regularly down there/my own experience.
You can be 5 minutes early to a fastpass, but on the dot.
Female let's player (and other things) from NYC here. Welcome!
Wish it was a little earlier than 4pm but...YEEEES. Just ran into that issue this past trip and forgot how annoying it can be.
A+
I think you'd have to book for 2, to make sure you have those two seats.

From someone who was crazy cynical about it because I had a nostalgic love for Maelstrom, I finally got on it this past weekend and thought it was great. Beautifully done, wonderful effects. Worth the long wait? no. we fastpassed it. But they did something really nice with what they had.
Also 1988! 2 years old :)

I also get a more sweaty behind, and it's a more recent symptom in the 4 years I've had my issues. I just chalk it up to the IBS. Sometimes it freaks me out because I feel wet and think it's diarrhea, but it's always just been sweat.

WRITING.TITLE: The first day in forever I feel ok
WRITING.TEXT: I've been on lexapro about a week, which I've taken 3 years ago and worked for me but went off of due to lay offs and lack of insurance, as well as hating weight gain from it. Well I'm back on it and today is the first day in months I've had zero pain,zero diarrhea, zero gas. I am just reveling in it right now. I hope this continues. I'll deal with the weight gain if it means more of this. I just wanted to share a God damn good day. Anyone else had any good days recently? I'd love to hear about it :)

Oh that sounds terrible! I have an annual pass and its just me so I don't have issue with tickets (my friends went home yesterday morning). I also never even made it to the airport yesterday I found out it was canceled while I was still in magic kingdom so I didn't lose any time. Today I didn't bother with parks though. I slept in. Too exhausted, and I should be heading to the airport in an hour and a half.

WRITING.TITLE: When your flight home gets cancelled....
WRITING.TEXT: You get put on a flight tomorrow and book another night, plus get to miss work since you fly in so late. I think this is real Disney magic, guys.

Thanks for the feedback. I already saw my Dr yesterday as we booked the 1 month later appointment immediately after I was prescribed. Didn't work even after a full month. I'm back on lexapro, which I took and worked a couple of years ago. I just wanted to try and move to something that wasn't brain chemistry altering but clearly is what I need. Fun times, I'm going through the upfront shakes and palpitations all over again until I get used to it in my system.

29, female, have been dealing with IBS-D for about 4 years now. how extreme it is has ebbed and flowed over that time. currently in a pretty bad point of it, and working with my GI to find something to help :-\ I havent had any behind a bush moments, but i have had plenty of gross random Dunkin Donuts/other food chain bathroom moments that are never fun.
I see them. I just put in random dates, oct 12th to 15th, and i see all the other resorts.
Thanks, awesome to hear you enjoy our videos. Winning a trip would be the BEST. Hope you have a great time!
This is my 12th trip so I feel totally ok taking some time for social media but I always make sure to just enjoy myself for sure!

Not strange, I do this at work constantly. Once someone uses the dryer I let it loose, then clamp up until they leave haha with plenty of courtesy flushes in between. But I've also noticed a lot of women in my office seem to not GAF and often when I'm just peeing I hear all their sounds.in the end we're human and we all poop, some just more than others. Hearing them just go actually makes me feel better about just going.
Yes. I wouldn't say it feels like... a spasm... more like its constricting, but i think thats also because its specifically around my pushing.
YES. it's SO loud. Its not even a gurgle so much as like... almost a suctioning groan noise. That's the best way i can describe it. But more so than anything i don't like the way it feels.

WRITING.TITLE: New Freaky Noise/Feeling During BM
WRITING.TEXT: So there's this new...noise and feeling i get, only during my worst BMs, so probably once every few weeks. Suddenly I'll be pushing, maybe slightly straining but not much...and then on my left side you can audibly hear this loud gurgle noise as i push and i can like...FEEL it. Any time it happens it freaks me the F out. If i push again, it'll happen again, with the pressure of pushing. I have never experienced this in my life, does anyone else get this? It often happens when i feel like im at the very end of multiple bad BMS, like my stomach is empty yet is still trying to go. it feels like as if an empty stomach is trying to push out nothing and thats the response. Should i be concerned this is something more serious?
BRB crying. I can't even imagine how magical that was for her.
Nothing gets me more excited than hearing about people who havent been in several years, returning. So much new for you!
You can get a pint of the stuff here in NYC for $10. So...a scoop at $6 does seem a bit steep, but I'd have to see how big that scoop actually is.

I cry every time I watch philharmagic. The Peter Pan part gets me every. time. I also shed some tears watching Illuminations. And I've been known to get watery eyed when I'm leaving.
I'm almost 30, btw ;) no shame.
We're going out Thursday, not Tuesday :) Where are you guys staying? We're doing All Star Sports.
Never realized those colors would look so great together haha
I dont think heat that hot can ever be something you get used to. I walk 15 min every morning (and evening) to the subway to get to work, and lately its been BRUTAL.
Thanks! it actually feels like 111 degrees here in NYC...so we've been on that heat train for a while now. I think we actually feel worse here than florida right now!
Just wanted to comment and say this topic sparked a [discussion video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVnGFgd2f9k) I did with a friend. Great question to think about...if a little scary ;)
hahaha "living the dream" is right! ;)
it is!
You too!
Pretty immediately after plans were made. One half I used jetblue points I had, other half I paid. I went with a 6:30 am flight because it was cheapest. Gonna hate myself that morning
haha nice! for a moment i considered changing my flight to wed after work and adding on a day but since im flying jetblue, changing means a hefty fee :-/
odd! if you just search subject7617 in youtube it's the first that pops up, but here's a [direct link](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdBVtFcCUvxHWvgoUmTLByg) :)
this. I had the same thought when reading that point. Maps would make it less immersive, i feel like.

WRITING.TITLE: 5 More Days Til Disney Woooorld!
WRITING.TEXT:
Just a humble brag. I am heading to the World on Thursday morning with a super early flight out of NYC. Will be there until Sunday evening. I have bigger 8 day trip planned in january but a friend of mine and I couldn't wait so we booked a short one about 6 weeks ago :) I will also be picking up my brand spanking new AP for the first time and I'm really excited about it!
some of you might know I vlog (on Youtube as the same name as my reddit username, IvyWinter) So yes, there will be vlogs. 2 of those days will be mostly solo so if that's your jam or you are thinking about a solo trip I'll be sure to capture that. I'll also be periscoping AND instagraming. SO MUCH SOCIAL MEDIAS.
I'm SO PUMPED I only have 3 more work days until the world :D
except thats not what he said and you just blew it out of proportion...so...

I've heard this has been a problem even for those WITH a gallbladder, its just even more likely without. I was very lucky i had zero side effects other than some loopiness the first day. I wish i could say it worked for me but... i guess it's time to try something different.
Sorry for your loss... my mom passed almost 10 years ago. Now i want to name a planet after her too :)

WRITING.TITLE: Viberzi Didn't Do a Thing For Me
WRITING.TEXT:
Following up from a post I made a bit ago, asking if Viberzi helped anyone. Its been almost the full 4 weeks of my prescription and it hasn't helped me one bit. I'm finishing it out as i have my drs appointment early next week, so i can say i took it 2x a day every day as i was supposed to, but i still have had D as much as ever, pain as much as ever. I wish the stories i read of other people saying it was a "miracle drug" applied to me.
I guess it's back to the drawing board :(

yes to a point. I try to still go to my gym like 2-3 times a week and i know theres a bathroom in the locker room i can easily access if something should happen. But sometimes i feel so icky all day (i go to the gym after work) that i just cant bring myself to go. Im like, so tired from hurting all day. So i miss days more than id like.

Not a problem at all, which is really weird because EVERYTHING ELSE is a problem haha. I drink like 3-4 cups a week though, i am not a heavy coffee drinker in general. There are some weeks I dont drink it at all, and it doesnt make my IBS any better (or worse).

About to go on vacation next week to Disney World. It's my happy place, and ive been enough to know where all the bathrooms are, but man am i praying a flare up doesnt hit while im in a long line for a ride. Beginning of Sept I am going to Portugal for a week with my boyfriend and his family. While they know about my IBS i still am having anxiety over possibly ruining the vacation if i wake up feeling sick and we have to like, drive somewhere or something. I am honestly freaking out.

Plenty of animals, none aggressive. Cold climate affecting environmental suit. Played for about 4 hours tonight and now I'm 3 hyper drive jumps away. Goodbye, Colorado! Hello really weird plot stuff (not gonna spoil it! )
Nope, NYC. I just have been to Colorado and this planet looks like it!
[Devarfrels-4 Mich](https://twitter.com/IvyWinterYT/status/762784539596972032). Gonna name it Colorado. Snowy mountains :D
Yup, mine does the same. Falls apart, looks shredded. Imodium works for me more than fiber or anything else. I am also unsure of the why but if you find anything out please let me know!

I dont get dry heaves but i get dull pains in the upper abdomen and i burp a LOT with bad indigestion. I also sometimes find when i have bad gas, ill also burp quite a bit too, like my body is trying to expel it anyway it can.

Its funny because for years from high school on i always had nervous belly. Even for exciting things. Job interviews, big tests, etc always brought about a bowel movement response, though not D. And now suddenly im suffering from IBS for the last 4 years. I wonder if people with "nervous belly" have more of a chance of having worse issues.
This. is. AWESOME. Kudos! I would totally do something similar haha

to add to this, i personally love knowing that if i want to see Fantasmic every darn night, without have to go to HS all day every day, I can. If i want to spend my day in AK and have dinner at Epcot to catch Illuminations, a plan I actually have upcoming, I can. If im going with a big group, as I often do, and we split up, i like the flexibility to make a decision to go meet them wherever they are, and not have to say "oh sorry guys today is an MK day, can't make it to hollywood studios at all to meet you." Im a BIG planner, to a T, but even i know things can change last minute and I want to have the flexibility to do so.
yuuuup. Every morning for me. 9 times out of 10 it leads into urgency and D too, after about 15 minutes. It sucks.

My boyfriend got frustrated a couple of weeks ago when i kicked him out of the bathroom, twice, one morning as he was trying to get ready for work. He gets i don't feel well, but in that moment he was like "Really? you need to go this many times?" For me, the emotional reaction was just tears :-/ He gave me a big hug and apologized later, but it made me feel like my IBS is not only affecting me but now others around me and i hate it.

Nope. I just went to the D.R., a major area of zika, on vacation. Used bug spray, was smart about exposure and have no plans to be pregnant for another few years. So if THAT didn't deter me, Disney World won't!
for me its more like, it's never one little one. Mine are loud and loooong in the mornings and I hate it, but it's the only way to get rid of the discomfort when i wake up.

I work 40+ hours a day at a digital agency. and yeah, there are days im often in the bathroom, trying to hurry up and not miss a meeting. Find an environment that is flexible. for the most part, if im a few minutes late to a meeting, or have to run out in the middle, my account team understands. I don't tell them explicitly WHY but life happens. My boss knows about my IBS and if im late, it's fine. I just make up that time at the end of the day. I've managed 2 raises and a promotion in my almost 2 years at this job, so it IS possible to work AND be successful. Just gotta work a little harder than everyone else ;)
I just ate an entire personal pizza, save for 2 crusts. I feel horrid. Don't worry, you aren't alone.

I'll second this. I can't give those moments up to chance. sometimes i have meetings at work where im presenting for an hour. I just have to take imodium a couple hours before hand, only sure fire way ill be ok.

I did not do a pill prep, but did throw up during my prep. By the second serving of suprep, i just couldnt keep it down. i threw up in a bucket while i sat on the toilet. Not my finest moment. The prep was still good and clear, though.
This is true, but trust me, i dont make enough to validate how absurd that number is haha. I split it with my boyfriend but we're moving to an outer borough soon because thats just cray.
Oh lord. I live in NYC and its $2650 for my 1 bedroom in manhattan. $970 sounds like a dream.
oddly, not bad the past couple of weeks haha i have just one that flares up once in a while.

My boss knows. She's very kind about it. I have to be at work 9:30 and typically walk in 9:45. Waking up earlier doesn't seem to help so I think some of it is anxiety and stress assuming I'll be late. I get to myself about it

100% agree with be better than everyone else. My boss knows about my ibs, she excuses my constant lateness but I also kick ass at work. Even though I'm often sick four days out of the week, I've still managed to get a promotion and get a raise. Its because I put in the extra hours that I miss in the mornings and I work my ass off to make sure that my IBS isn't a detriment to my job.
Been in and out the past 40 minutes. No big deal just probably gonna be late for work. Again. Bleh.
No Man's Sky, Dishonored 2, Telltale Batman. also Watch Dogs 2. I really enjoyed the first one, despie naysayers, and im looking forward to hacking ALL THE THINGS.

something weird going on today. My friend got sent a whole new confirmation # for our DVC stay in January. No changes seem to be made, and yet he sent a brand new # and that new # was updated on our reservations on the website. Can't figure out why, but as long as everything seems the same I guess it's fine?
Also in the same boat. I booked ohana for 6:45. Currently MK closes at 8pm. if it changes, then we can just go out on the beach and watch wishes then :)
That man is a KEEPER. sorry to hear this but you handled it as well as you could! Gold star!
thanks that insight is helpful.

I think thats awesome advice for people who havent been ,or only been a couple of times. For someone like myself, though, who has been 11 times with a 12th (and 13th) coming up, for the most part ive seen those queues many times over haha. Unless im in toy story midway mania, in which case i am entertained by everything around me!
I feel like im going to splurge when i want to anyway, but i do like this. I generally count calories and while i wont let that take away from "vacation foodie-ing" its nice to know.
Yeah its actually rather low calorie, dole whips. eat without guilt!

Yeah i got real loopy on my first dose saturday morning, but that was about it. Yeah so far, two days of very gassy as well but this morning was just not good. Then again, it was before i even took my 5th dose, and for the rest of the day ive been fine so far. *knock on wood*

WRITING.TITLE: How Long Until Viberzi Worked Well (For Those On It)?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi all. I just started Viberzi on Saturday, 1 pill twice a day, 100mg. Saturday I was ok, no BMs (my last one was early friday evening, i had D at work around 6pm), Sunday i was bloated and gassy but no BMs. This morning I woke up and started off with a normal BM (whoa, unheard of). No pain. But it quickly degraded into 3 more BMs of my usual loose stools + passing gas at the same time. Less pain than usual, which was a plus, but still, going 4 times in an hour isnt what id call major improvement. Thats my usual bad morning. That said, i know its only been 2 full days on the meds. Anyone with experience find it took some time to feel normal? anyone feel like it never worked? Im willing to give it a full week before making any real judgements but man i was hoping all those stories i read of "it worked right away!" would be me :-/ **EDIT:** It's been over a week and viberzi hasn't made a huge difference. Still D 50% of the days. Im going to continue it until my dr appointment on the 15th but i don't think ill be continuing if i don't suddenly see signs of improvement. *sigh*

Yeah i take imodium generally but it doesnt stop the morning pain/multiple BMS/lateness to work. though right now im taking viberzi and im uncertain if im allowed to take imodium with...though its day 3 on the meds and i am having a flare up :-/
I've been to Morocco, Marrakech specifically, and it makes me really appreciate more so how beautiful this pavilion is. It is just like the real thing.
Glad to hear. yeah right now im on 2 a day. just took my first one, 100mg. ill see how the two works :)
The viberzi actually just came in this evening so im going to start it tomorrow. any side effects so far?

I did a low fodmap diet for 2+ months several months ago, through guidance of my GI. Didnt do anything to help my symptoms. At this point, i just avoid known triggers as much as possible, but i still can feel sick on pretty much anything.

My roommates at the time knew i needed the bathroom and so one of them went over a friends for the night and the other was just aware and stayed out of it as much as she could. They were really accommodating. Maybe just chat with the people you live with, be honest. it's only 1 day or night or whatever.

WRITING.TITLE: Barely ate today, still D
WRITING.TEXT: Been feeling sick most days this week. This morning i was doing OK but after feeling especially bad yesterday i didnt eat breakfast. Ate a very, very light lunch. suddenly now, 5pm. D. Ran to my work bathroom in a hurry, passed some gas, had D. I know that its likely food from even yesterday and that the digestive system isnt as cut and dry as what you eat every day coming out within 24 hours or anything, but im still just so frustrated. I need to leave and go home soon and now I'm dreading my commute. thank yoooou IBS. I did get a prescription for viberzi yesterday from my dr but my pharmacy had to order it in and it's not there yet :-/ all I can do right now is cope with imodium. I am so, so tired of being sick. It's been the worst it's ever been the past 3 months or so.
Take 1-2 almost daily, dr has told me there's no real side effects from "overdosing" other than some constipation that can be easily rectified.

I always do park on day of check in, but i also tend to take very early morning flights in. My flight next month is at 6:30am. I'll be at MCO by 8:30, 9am and at the hotel hopefully by 10:30. If the room isnt ready i have them hold my bags and just go off to the parks! I am taking a later flight in january, getting in around 4:30pm, and i still think i may do a leisurely evening at night. I am an adult with no kids though who usually goes with friends, so keep in mind its easier for me to do stuff like that. YMMV with kids in tow!
Im going to miss it while im there, but i know the animatronics need some real work, so i can deal i guess.
I once got stuck going down into the graveyard, where you are practically on your back. it was a little alarming/weird haha

same! did it on my sept 2015 trip. was so scared and then when i finally went up, its so peaceful and beautiful! you get an amazing view of the parks and we even saw some backstage stuff. Awesome experience.

So i work at a digital agency. While my boss does know my situation, there are times where im on say, a call with a client that im leading, for maybe an hour, and i cannot just walk out of said room for anything. My boss is cool with me being late for work, and if im in internal meetings with my teams sometimes i can take a break, but sometimes i dont have that luxury. Forget it when i have actual face to face client meetings. I love my job, very much, but sometimes it can be a struggle.
I'll be there in a month. If no one going sooner offers I can help you out!

I second this. The last 5 of my trips iwent as an adult with significant others or other adult friends. No children as none of us have any yet. We go and we enjoy everything all the rides, all the restaurants, and the nightlife. If you want a more mature scene try disney springs or the boardwalk late at night but really, everything can be enjoyed as an adult. Even dumbo.
i mean, on weekends, sure. at work? not really haha because then i have anxiety that ive been missing in the bathroom for too long, or im going to be late for a meeting, etc.

i think the thing is im not holding back so much as i just have that constant pressure making me THINK i need to and when i try to, nothing actually happens. and then its like wasting time running to a bathroom for nothing.
I'll second HelloFromFlorida (omg, i wrote HellFromFlorida first hahaha). They also respond to every comment and are just a fun couple!

were you never tested for lactose intolerance from the get go? I was and it came back negative, which is why i ask because im still skeptical. I guess the only way to truly know is to just cut out diary for a week.

WRITING.TITLE: Constant Feeling of Pressure Around Anus After Flare Up
WRITING.TEXT: Do you guys get this after having a flare up? anything to help? Im so uncomfortable right now. I had a big flare up this morning (i think from a cup of popcorn yesterday). I went 5x in a little over an hour. And now im at work, with that pressure/discomfort around my anus. Is this normal? Is there any way to help it? It often takes hooours before i feel better, and it makes me paranoid like im going to go again.
